name: isolable
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
Something that is isolable can be isolated (= separated) from the things with which it is connected or mixed: isolable from The building is not isolable from the social networks that have interacted in and around it at different times. The elderly are not an isolated or isolable segment of society; they are integral to it.
More examplesFewer examplesI noted at the beginning that gender is not clearly isolable from other social categories.These isolable but unstable and reactive compounds have a typical fresh garlic aroma and taste.
